column1: '''Elvish Song in Rivendell''' is a poem written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]
column2: probably dating from the early 1930s. Apparently
column3: the poem was at some point intended by Tolkien to be included in the chapter "A Short Rest" from ''The Hobbit''
column4: following the passage: "The [the elves] went into another song as ridiculous as the one I have written down in full." It exists in two versions
column5: one untitled and titled. The latter (supposedly the latest) was published for the first time by [[Douglas A. Anderson]] in ''[[The Annotated Hobbit: Revised and Expanded Edition]]'' (2002).
